page.title: 08St. Mary's Church Choir
page.content: The chancel arch leads to the choir. The choir sit in seats which are called choir stalls. There are twelve to fourteen girls in the choir and five adults. Mr. Booker is the choir master and Mr. David Burton is the organist. The choir has a processional cross, with which it processes to and from the choir stalls. There are a lot of stained glass windows by the choir stalls. The East window, depicting "The Vision of Piers Plowman", is noteworthy. By the choir stalls there is a desk where the priests sometimes sit. The choir wear red cassocks and white surplices. The cassock goes underneath the surplice. The choir gets paid every year. I am no longer in the choir, but my cousin and two friends are still members.
